title: Music-KG-Project
description: The Music Sampling Knowledge Graph project involves setting up a Neo4j database, injecting data into it, and launching a Streamlit application. The repository includes directories for documentation, knowledge graph data, notebooks, and scrapers, along with a `requirements.txt` file for dependencies.

title: CascaProject
description: The Casca Project automates the evaluation of loan eligibility by processing financial documents, such as bank statements, through a workflow that converts PDFs into images and analyzes them using OpenAI's GPT-4 model. This approach streamlines financial assessments by integrating advanced AI capabilities.

title: SetupForge
description: SetupForge is a Windows desktop application developed in C++ using wxWidgets, designed to automate software installations and system configurations. It enables users to create and execute custom scripts for tasks like running executables, managing files and directories, setting environment variables, editing the registry, and mapping network drives.

title: cs566-project
description: SegOne is a channel-wise 1D convolutional U-Net designed for efficient and accurate segmentation of one-dimensional data. The project includes comprehensive documentation, configuration files, datasets, and the core implementation of the SegOne model.

title: E-DataSync-Distributed-E-Commerce-Inventory-Management
description: E-DataSync is a distributed e-commerce inventory management system designed to efficiently handle database management and query processing. The project includes a user-friendly web application interface, with a clear repository structure comprising backend, frontend, and application pages.

title: pe-consensus-scoring
description: The PE Consensus Scoring project deploys algorithms on AWS Lambda to process messages related to consensus requests and article publishing, utilizing SQS queues for efficient handling.

title: software-dev
description: The "software-dev" repository contains prototype files developed by the Public Editor Software Development Team. ([github.com](https://github.com/Goodly/software-dev?utm_source=openai))

title: 2022-wi-stats21
description: The repository contains instructional materials for a statistics course, including Jupyter notebooks, PDFs, and scripts covering topics such as Git basics, Jupyter Notebook usage, and fundamental data types.

title: CalHackss
description: The CalHackss repository contains partial code from a project developed during the CalHacks hackathon. Due to GitHub's 50MB storage limit, the full codebase isn't uploaded. The repository includes various directories and files, such as `app.py`, `my_script.py`, and a `README.md` file, which provides a brief overview of the project's scope and limitations.

title: chrisapton.github.io
description: The repository `chrisapton.github.io` contains the source code for my personal website, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript files, and assets like images and a PDF resume.

title: Coding_Assessment_2024
description: The Applicant Compatibility Scoring System is a Python script that evaluates candidates for a technical team by calculating compatibility scores based on attributes such as intelligence, strength, endurance, and tolerance for spicy food. It utilizes NumPy and pandas for data processing and requires an input JSON file named `input.json` to operate.

title: Heart-Disease-Prediction
description: The Heart Disease Prediction project involves analyzing heart disease data using R to develop predictive models. The repository contains R Markdown files, datasets, and a PDF report detailing the analysis and findings.

title: MITHacks
description: Enlighten Me is a web application that facilitates real-time debates on controversial topics, featuring a Python backend with Flask and a frontend built using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React. Every five minutes, the platform refreshes with a new topic, clearing the chat to encourage fresh discussions.

title: projects
description: The GitHub repository at [https://github.com/chrisapton/projects](https://github.com/chrisapton/projects) contains a `README.md` file and a `hello.txt` file. However, it lacks a detailed description, website link, or specified topics, making it challenging to provide a comprehensive overview of its contents.

title: round_robin
description: The "round_robin" repository contains the source code for the Encore Round Robin website, including HTML, CSS, and image files. The site is accessible at [roundrobinstore.com](https://roundrobinstore.com).

title: STATS-199-Research-SPR-2023
description: The STATS-199-Research-SPR-2023 repository contains materials from a research project conducted during the Spring 2023 semester. It includes Jupyter notebooks (`STATS_199_1.ipynb`, `STATS_199_ARIMAX.ipynb`), a final project report (`STATS_199_Final_Project.pdf`), code documentation (`STATS_199_code.pdf`), and a data file (`submission.csv`).
